equivalent_weight.description: Amine and hydroxyl functionality for NCO/OH and cure-ratio calculations.
equivalent_weight.notes: Values from 3M Dynamar HX-878 product bulletin; use for preliminary cure-ratio calculations and verify against the current TDS.

recommended_usage.role_in_propellant: bonding agent / processing aid for AP or AN in HTPB matrices
mixing_notes: Add early in the mix cycle before curatives so that ammonia liberated from AP can be removed under vacuum or by sparging.
Intended to reduce end-of-mix viscosity and improve mechanical properties of cured propellant.

other_references.description: 3M Dynamar HX-878 product bulletin (bonding agent / processing aid)
TEPANOL / HX-878 technical summary and parameters (Tanyun)

safety.hazards_summary: Toxic polynitrile hydroxylamine polymer; health hazards not fully characterized. Avoid skin and eye contact; avoid inhalation of vapors or aerosols.
recommended_ppe: splash goggles or safety glasses with side shields
local exhaust ventilation or respirator if aerosols/vapors may be present

conditions: store sealed in a cool, dry, well-ventilated area
storage.shelf_life_notes: Refer to current manufacturer TDS; typical shelf life is at least 12 months in unopened containers stored cool and dry.

notes: Acts as a bonding agent between AP/AN surfaces and HTPB binder, improving mechanical properties and reducing end-of-mix viscosity.
Ammonia evolution during reaction with AP can cause foaming if not removed; vacuum or sparging step is required.
